intro: Phyllostegia brevidens var. heterodoxa, commonly known as the narrowleaf strobilanthes, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves with a hairy underside. The plant produces showy, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple, arranged in clusters at the base of the leaves. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical forests. Due to its ornamental value and unique floral structure, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens.
